msgSnippet: ... Where is your java classpath?  Java uses the classpath variable, not the system s path variable. You need something like: java -cp

Subject: Re: [junit] Need help with JUnit and Win98

From: Joi Ellis <joi@...>

On Fri, 11 May 2001, Kent Johnson wrote:

> Hi All,
> 
> I am having what I hope is a simple problem. I am trying to run JUnit on 
> Win98 and keep getting the dreaded:
> 
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
> junit/textui/TestRunner
> 
> when I type:
> 
> java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> 
> at the prompt no matter what directory I am in.
> 
> I have JUnit installed in C:\junit3.6
> 
> my path in AutoExec.bat is as follows:
> 
> SET 
> PATH=c:\Perl\bin\;C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~6\VT6\BIN;C:\jdk1.3.0_02\bin;C:\junit3.6;C:\junit3.6\junit.jar;C:\junit3.6\junit;C:\junit3.6\junit\tests;C:\junit3.6\junit\samples;C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~6\COMMON\MSDEV98\BIN;%PATH%
> 
> As you can see,  I'm desperate. jdk1.3.0_02 is installed and working 
> perfectly. I installed JUnit on an NT box last week and it worked perfectly 
> the first time.
 
Where is your java classpath?  Java uses the classpath variable, not the
system's path variable.

You need something like:

java -cp c:\junit3.6\junit.jar;c:\junit36\junit\tests;c:\junit3.6\samples
  junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

or

set CLASSPATH=c:\jdk1.3.0_02\bin;C:\junit3.6\junit.jar;c:\junit3.6\samples
ava junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
-- 
Joi Ellis                    Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies          joi@..., gyles19@...
